content.heading: Scabies Mite Characteristics
bullet_points: Characterized by thin, slightly elevated, wavy grey-white burrows containing mites and eggs

content.heading: Transmission and Clinical Presentation
bullet_points: Transmitted through direct skin contact or fomite transmission
Common sites for burrows include fingers, toes, wrists, elbows, axillae, lower abdomen, beneath breasts, and genitalia

content.heading: Scabies Mite Types
bullet_points: Classic, nodular, or crusted (Norwegian scabies) variants
Classic scabies has 10 to 15 mites per individual, while crusted scabies can have millions
Crusted scabies occurs in immunocompromised individuals

content.heading: Clinical Features and Manifestations
bullet_points: Nodular scabies presents with erythematous nodules in axilla and groin
Crusted scabies may not show typical signs and symptoms
